comment: Professor Harr-Lagin is nice, but it is impossible to reach her. We had to write four speeches, and half the class has gotten no feedback or grade. There are 3 days left till final grades are due, and the grade book is empty.

My only complaint is that she is pretty inaccessible. Since the class is online, our only options to communicate with her are through email or a class-wide discussion board. Several of my classmates have emailed her up to 3 times with no response, and the discussion posts for questions about the class go unanswered as well. Otherwise she seems nice
Nobody enjoys public speaking but Professor Harr-Lagin makes it a little bit better. Don't be scared of this class, you got it!

You use a platform called revel to do readings and quizzes. its pretty easy most of the answers are on quizlet if you need help. does take attendance and does in class participation. Lecture can be boring sometimes but she keeps it interesting with stories or by getting the class involved. Easy class very nice professor would def take her again.

Shes a decent professor, I wouldnt say shes the best because she NEVER responded to any of my emails. I also scheduled a meeting with her because her assignments are all over the place and an hour before our meeting she sent me a text stating that wed have to reschedule.

Be prepared to do a lot of busy work. Every week you had to take 3+ chapter quizzes, do a speech or a speech reflection, speech written work, and 1-2 other activities per module. There was a midterm and a final. I think the activities were for completion, because I got a 100 on them, but she has not graded any of the speeches so idk how i did.

This professor's lectures are pretty boring but the class is extremely easy. Attendance is mandatory but you can miss up to 5 classes without it messing with your grade. You have EASY quizzes every week from the textbook and you have the choice to take the tests at home or in class, she does use a lock down browser but no webcam.
Extremely boring lectures. Seriously. Class is very easy, but going is extremely hard, especially in the morning. Do not recommend if you aren't a fan of being extremely bored and antsy.

Class is super easy. There are weekly quizzes and textbook readings. She'll do participation activities throughout the semester during class. Only two tests but they are super easy. She is very understanding and will make sure you understand the topics
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Kelsey Harr-Lagin was a good professor. Her lectures are long, but such an easy class. Want an A to boost your GPA, take Kelsey Harr-Lagin.
Easy class. Has a few participation activities in class but if you make a buddy then you can skip most of the time and just pretend you were there.

Kelsey is a fine prof. She lets you call her by her first name. This class was easy but sooooo much busy work. She is also very slow with grading, you wont see most of your grades till finals week. She doesn't respond quick to emails but the class is very simple. Take it asynchronously is you can!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Public Speaking. She is not involved in the class at all. Lots of work each week. The worst part is she does not update the grades all semester. This class is about feedback on speeches and she gives none of that. Lots of work but she usually grades easily, just don't expect to get them back until the end of the year.

I took professor Harr-Lagin for comm 1100 her class is super easyyyy. She doesnt require attendance however there are random participation in class activities for a grade. Every week there are revel quizzes but if you read it then the answers are obvious. The tests were online with lockdown browser but no webcam. Shes understanding and laidback
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I've neve had a more horrible professor. I have zero idea how I am doing in the class. the ONLY reason why she finally put grades in was because I emailed her boss! And she hasn't been in anything since. She is literally is nonexistent. I understand its online, but we get ZERO feedback and no grades. Good luck emailing her she wont respond. AVOID
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Shes nice but unreliable. If you send an email for help, dont expect a response any earlier than 3 days. Despite the syllabus saying she updates grades every other week, 85% werent submitted until the last minute. So, is the class easy? Sure. But without instructor feedback, the speeches often felt like going into gun fights empty-handed.

Unfortunately, I did not receive a single grade for this class until final grades were posted. I even emailed her to ask about grading and how to know if I was doing alright on my speeches. She never answered. The class is easy but you won't have any idea if you are going to pass until it is too late.
Easy class, but makes it way too political. The class teaches bunk and unhealthy things.

Super sweet and caring prof! There are 5 speeches and a lot of busy work. It is not too difficult but she can tend to grade a little tough on speeches and knock points off for frivolous things. It made me grow as a public speaker though. Overall, I would take her again!

Cant say much about the teacher, but this class is really an easy A. I didn't interact with the teacher at all because it is online and because her D2/L is super organized and accessible; never communicated with her. I would say there is a TON of reading and quizzes on REVEL, but it's easy to get through if you put in some work.
I learned a lot. There were interesting assignments. There were 12 assignments I think, but you can choose to do 5 because only 5 are graded. The midterm and final were open note. Very easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Harr-Lagin was amazing. I took her online and her class consisted of weekly discussions, assignments, small quizes and 4 speeches. She is so nice, caring and helpful! Her lectures are clear and easy. Everything is on quizlet if you need it. Read the chapters and do the assignments and you'll get an A. Definitely recommend!

She won't respond to your emails so groupme is essential. She's an easy grader and nice. I took her online class. I got all A's on the speeches but we took one test and the class average was an 82% and it dropped all of our grades a lot, but other than that as long as you put in the work and manage your assignments well you'll get an A.

Although I didn't always agree with her views on the topics we talked about, I do believe that she is a good professor. She cares about her students and she is very understanding with missing assignments (as long as it doesn't happen a lot). She will explain things more clear if you ask. She is fairly good at answering emails.

I really like this professor. She gives clear examples for topics she teaches about and is available outside of class if you need help. This class is an easy A as long as you read the textbook and show up to class, attendance is a grade!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I am a senior, I took her for my last year and by far she is my favorite teacher. She embodies what she teaches when it comes to public speaking. She is super relatable, giving personal anecdotes and goes head over heels to help us not only in public speaking but also anything else at KSU related to other classes or just problems we need help with.

I did all the work . Passed everything but when it came down to the attendance, she could care less. I went from a B to an a F simply because i missed class but makes no sense when my attendance did not affect my overall performance. She claims its a department policy but its bs. I would look into it cause thats not fair
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Harr-Lagin is a very nice younger lady. She expects you to do your work, be professional, and show up to class. She allowed you to use a cheat sheet on all tests and the exam. Much of the test material were things out of the book that were barely mentioned in class. The speeches were not too difficult and had clear grading criteria.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Harr-Lagin is very nice. However, she spends the majority of the class telling stories about her previous students. She also never provided good feedback when she was asked questions. She would always say to see her after class and would never answer directly. She never responded to emails and was hard to get a hold of out of class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Kelsey is honestly a great professor. She made public speaking very bearable. She was not a tough grader, so its an easy A if you do the work. I would take her again if she was an option. Class is manadatory, but its not a tough lecture to sit through. Tests are easy and she allows a cheat sheet.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Kelsey was not great. She rambles on and on the entire class, giving endless personal anecdotes and wasting everyone's time. She takes attendance every class, but won't give you any credit towards your grade... unless you miss more than 2, then you automatically FAIL. Stay away.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Kelsey makes her expectations known the very first day of class. She makes the content relatable which made the class a lot easier for me. I loved this class would definitely take it again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is such a good teacher. Even though her class is mandatory I didn't really mind coming to class. She makes a public speaking class not so bad. I am very comfortable now with my class because she helps us so much with giving speeches. I highly recommend taking her over an online class.
DO NOT TAKE KELSEY!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Probably one of my least favorite professors to date. She tries to goad students in very unfair ways. She focuses on "white privilege" far too much. Even acknowledged she was doing it and anyone in the hall that overheard her could likely report her. She says "does that make sense" over 20 times during each lecture. Her tests are difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her class is so important that if you get a very good grade but didn't go to class, because it's just so important, you fail.

She's super nice! Lectures are a bit boring, but if you pay attention you will do well on the tests. A bit homework heavy, because the quizzes for each chapter are due before you go over the chapter in class, but the tests are very similar to the quizzes. You can only miss 4 classes before your grade begins to drop.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Take her if you can. Honestly she was so fun and had stories to tell every class. She was very easy going and caring if it came to emergencies or not turning in assignments on time. She tells you exactly what you need to do and makes it very fair and clear. 10/10 would recommend. She's great.

Class is mainly lecture and can get pretty boring. She cares about her students and if you talk to her outside of class she will work to help you do well in her class. Probably the best COM1100 class and I am glad O took her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Kelsey is AMAZING! She's super sweet and funny and she clearly loves what she's teaching. She truly cares about her students. Pretty much all of the work in the class comes form the book, so do the reading and take the quizzes and you'll get an A.

Easy grader on speeches. Midterm covers a ridiculous amount of topics straight from the book. The final is cumulative. Biggest problem is I'm taking it in the summer so it's a 3 hour class and she talks the ENTIRE TIME. Nobody pays attention because everything is from the book - you need the textbook to study for the tests and workbook for speeches

Public Speaking is something a lot of people dread, but this teacher makes light of a subject a lot of people don't like. She understands people are scared, and she's so warm that you don't feel as intimidated as you would giving a presentation in another class.
She rambles and rambles throughout class and it annoys everyone. Her tests are very hard for no reason. I would find another teacher honestly.

You have a couple tests and a weekly online quiz. As long as you read the book and study the vocab and theorems you should be fine. I wish she used a powerpoint or some other visual cue, since I'm a visual learner I have a hard time remembering what she said in class long enough to just write it down. Read BEFORE class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I'm currently taking her class now and so far it has been horrible. SO BORING. She claims that you need to come to class but honestly you could learn everything by just reading the book. I've showed up to every class so far but usually during that time several students will get up and walk out because it is so pointless.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Harr-Lagin was my favorite professor this semester. She makes you feel really comfortable when you're speaking in front of the class and reassures you that you're doing well. There were 5 speeches and 2 tests, all of which were easy. Practice your speeches and go to class and you'll be fine.

She is straight to the point on assignments, but then goes on and on about scenarios.  At times was a little picky on grading, but overall not a bad choice to have for a class.(Very passable)  In this class you do more research for speech classes than I thought.

Lectures were overall very boring, she cancels a lot of classes and lets out the others early. Not dependable whatsoever, says shell post something on D2L and never does until a min before next class. Still don't have feedback for our group project she said she was going to send before the semester was over, its January. Lazy, but easy to work with

Brings personal values into her teaching. Goes off onto tangents. Long boring lectures. Monitors you while you take a test at home. Kind of easy class but not worth the work load and the content was very stupid. Try to avoid class all together.
Try to show up to class as often as you can, but as long as you deliver all the speeches and is present for the tests, she's not likely to punish you.
Easy A. She is so helpful and chill when it comes to the speeches. Doesn't require you to get dressed up.
Literally did four speeches. Shes so nice and doesn't make you dress up; super funny too.

If you ask her for help she will go out of her way to meet with you outside of class as much as you want to practice your speeches or review your outlines. She is one of the few profs who is actually a kind person and respects students. Her assignments are incredibly detailed and clear so you know exactly what to expect and do to do them good.

Where do I begin.. I decided to take her based on the "glowing" reviews from previous semesters.  I was actually excited to learn some new skills. She was a complete and utter waste of time of a teacher.  I agree fully with the previous negative reviews.  Perhaps she had a bad semester, but she was there to do her job and do it well.  Tsk tsk...

Hard to rate this class since she canceled class sometimes and either changed, pushed back or cancelled assignments all together. Talks the entire class period, but can EASILY go off subject for awhile. Didn't receive any major work or grades until the end of the semester. I ended up making an A, but didn't feel like I learned very much.

The class was easy for the most part but confusing. Speeches seemed easy but grading was a bit harsh. It was as if she graded on your outline instead of the speech. Follow the speech requirements to a tee if you want a perfect grade. I wouldn't take her again. Still she is worth taking and an easy pass (not an A though).

The thing that peeved me most was how there was no schedule for the entire second half of the semester, starting after spring break. I like to stay on top of my assignments since I'm a busy person, but I feel like I was robbed of that opportunity.

I had to rate everything a 1 because I had no idea what was happening in this class.  We learned nothing, talked about nothing and didn't receive a clear assignment, let alone grade, until the last three weeks of the semester.  I don't even know if I will pass but maybe if I take it again we will do something.

Fantastic teacher! She was extremely nice, extremely helpful, and made making speeches a lot easier than it could have been, but there were a lot of petty assignments that added up (my grade was much lower than it should have been but I deserved it).

She is prob the best public speaking teacher at SPSU. the longest speech is 4-5 mins while other teachers' are around 10-15, I've heard. Cancels class more often than my other teachers, i think thats a +. Extremely easy, gives extra credit, Strongly recommended if you hate speaking infront of people , she goes easy on you and relieves you from fear
Best speech teacher I think you can take. Very clear with instructions, and don't miss speech days! Of all the prof. she makes all speeches the shortest! NO FINAL EXAM! You won't regret it.

VERY helpful you just have to ask for help and she will go out of her way to help. Assignments tell you exactly what you need to do and explain every detail almost to the point of being annoying.Funny, honest, and knows what she is talking about.

She's a big girl. The purpose of this class is to try to make the student a decent public speaker by giving you confidence. Quizzes (what few we had) were nitpicky and difficult. Speeches require some work to be put in. Two of them required a moderate amount of research and citation. Pretty nice and willing to help in any way she can.

As long as you read the chapters and show up to class you will do fine. She is fun but can talk from the beginning of class to the end sometimes. Great teacher though. She is one of the easier public speaking classes

A very good teacher. Her class is not hard, but does require a lot of work, possibly more than a 2-hour class should require. She makes sure to be extremely clear in her instructions, and I found lectures to be kinda fun. Must complete 4 speeches and 2 (easy) exams. Likes cats.

She seemed like a hardass at first, but the class got better.  Pretty fun class, not too hard material.  Just make sure to go over the chapters when she tells you about the ones to read and practice your speeches.
Grades really hard on speeches! Also, the work load is much more than a 2 credit hour class. Its more like 3 or 4. Wouldnt recommend and will not be taking another one of her classes.

She's very helpful and makes things as clear as she can. You have 4 speeches and you must do all of them. attendance is mandatory. Work on improving and do the outlines correctly. no reason not to get a good grade. Takes a while to email people back. Always willing to hear your plea but won't necessarily give in.
